title: Bug: Stack overflow when serializing objects with circular references in eslint/lib/shared/serialization.js

labels.name: core
labels.description: Relates to ESLint's core APIs and features

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

body:
### Environment

Node version:20.18.3
npm version:11.1.0
Local ESLint version: the latest main branch
Global ESLint version:
Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04


### What parser are you using?

Default (Espree)

### What did you do?

<details>
<summary>Configuration</summary>

```js
<!-- Paste your configuration here -->
```
</details>

```js
<!-- Paste your code here -->
```
The eslint/lib/shared/serialization.js module does not properly handle circular references in objects during serialization. This can lead to a maximum call stack size exceeded error when attempting to serialize data structures containing circular references.

### What did you expect to happen?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f4263f1a-3a3d-4678-80b0-e82b1ea57fd3)

### What actually happened?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7272cf04-74c6-46b2-b338-8f119fc74842)

### Link to Minimal Reproducible Example

https://eslint.org/play/#

### Participation

- [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

### Additional comments

_No response_
